translation: Dwelling in solitude, eating sparingly, with speech, body, and mind subdued, always engaged in meditation and concentration, and resorting to dispassion.
commentary: 18.52 Viviktasevi dwelling in solitude? Light eating but little? Yatavakkayamanasaá¸¥ speech? body and mind subdued? Dhyana Yogaparah engaged in meditation and concentration? Always always? Vairagyam dispassion? resorting to resorting to.Commentary Solitude has its own charms. The spiritual vibrations in solitude are wonderfully elevating. Meditation will come by itself without exertion. All saints and sages
